page.title: 07GRAVEL PITS, RADLEY
page.content:
These, now disused, gravel pits are owned by the Central Electricity Generating Board. They are being filled in with flyash from the Didcot powerstations. Flyash is used for motorway construction but there is excess due to insufficient demand. The flyash is mixed into a solution with water and pumped into the pits where it sinks to the bottom. Unfortunately this has produced a pollution hazard for the wildlife which includes herons ducks, geese and fish.
The project should be completed in about twenty years when the reclaimed land will be used for housing and agriculture.
Security is high, the entire area being protected by a high perimeter fence.
